Roaring Silence of Obsidian

Jeremiah Walton

Arizona’s northern desert wears a patchy jacket of hand me down foliage cast off by thousands of years</br> of silence </br> Half baked mountains observe the asphalt arteries we are pumping thru</br> Oi, we’re on the run </br> on the run from boredom </br> & boredom’s burning coat of years</br> trailing along the experiential embers </br> that shine light from your belly </br> illuminating the naked buried in your skin.</br> There’s a prickly pear beer top in my pocket </br> & thousands of miles carrying the silence of obsidian </br> yet to scratch the record player mind.</br>
